verbs.description: sweeten (third-person singular simple present sweetens, present participle sweetening, simple past and past participle sweetened)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To make sweet to the taste.
(transitive) To make (more) pleasant or to the mind or feelings.
(transitive) To make mild or kind; to soften.
(transitive) To make less painful or laborious; to relieve.
examples: to sweeten the cares of life

entries.meaning: (transitive) To soften to the eye; to make delicate.
examples: Correggio has made his memory immortal by the strength he has given to his figures, and by sweetening his lights and shadows, and melting them into each other.

entries.meaning: (transitive) To make pure and salubrious by destroying noxious matter.
examples: to sweeten rooms or apartments that have been infected

entries.meaning: (transitive) To restore to purity; to free from taint.
examples: to sweeten water, butter, or meat

entries.meaning: (transitive) To make more attractive; said of offers in negotiations.
examples: to sweeten the deal by increasing the price offered

entries.meaning: (music, transitive) To supplement (a composition) with additional instruments, especially strings.
examples: In most popular music the bowed strings usually play long, sustained, sweeping parts, and are sometimes added to a vocal track later in a process known as sweetening.
